snippet: Rising numbers have joined the Islamic State and other groups, prompting fears of domestic terrorism when the fighters return home.
abstract: European countries press ahead with new efforts to deter growing numbers of their citizens seeking to join radical Islamic movements in Iraq and Syria; some experts have warned that United States-led military campaign against Islamic State increases risk that groups will turn their attention to attacking Western targets.

byline.contributor: Maïa de la Baume contributed reporting from Paris, and Kimiko de Freytas-Tamura from London.

lead_paragraph: Rising numbers have joined the Islamic State and other groups, prompting fears of domestic terrorism when the fighters return home.

headline.main: Europe Tries to Stop Flow of Citizens Joining Jihad
headline.print_headline: Europe Tries to Stop Flow of Citizens Joining Jihad

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
